comments.body: can you add a comment with the issue number describing this case (put above these cases)

@jreback thx for your advice. comments are added. 

I don't understand what to do as to add a test case in panda/tests/reductions/test_reductions.py as you described
`def test_all_any_params(self) is the relevant test`

Do you mean adding a function called `test_all_any_params` to test the completeness of parameter coverage?

no, you look for this test where I indicated, then add a similar one (or parameterize the existing is best) with a Series that has pd.NA values. (these test whether your patch works with Series). This test you augmented here is for Array, which is fine, but need to test both.

Thx for clarification. I add a test similar to `test_all_any_params(self)` and also test the bug exposed related to issue #33253. However, it is not a full boolean coverage test compared to the test in `pandas/tests/arrays/boolean/test_reduction.py`. Do you think it is necessary to copy the code under` @pytest.mark.parametrize` you indicate from `pandas/tests/arrays/boolean/test_reduction.py` to `panda/tests/reductions/test_reductions.py `?

Parametrizing doesn't seem that easy, since the existing one is a object dtype with NaN and True/False, which has quite different behaviour than boolean dtype. So adding a similar but separate test as you did is fine.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +21,25 @@        ([], False, True, False, True),
        # GH-33253: all True / all False values buggy with skipna=False
        ([True, True], True, True, True, True),
        ([False, False], False, False, False, False),
    ],
